intro: Physaria rosei, commonly known as the rose blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, seed-like structures called cypsela in its fruit. Physaria rosei is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
